channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: With Trump’s Backing Uncertain, Europe Scrambles to Shore Up Its Own Defenses
item.description: European leaders will gather Monday to plot a rough path forward on defense. Wavering support from President Trump is likely to drive the debate.

item.title: With Trump’s Backing Uncertain, Europe Scrambles to Shore Up Its Own Defenses
item.description: European leaders will gather Monday to plot a rough path forward on defense. Wavering support from President Trump is likely to drive the debate.

item.title: Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists Names Alexandra Bell Its New President
item.description: Alexandra Bell is bringing more than a decade of experience in nuclear policy to the organization that sets the Doomsday Clock.

item.title: Who Will Govern Postwar Gaza? Four Competing Models Are Emerging.
item.description: Hamas still controls most of the enclave, but Israel holds some key areas. International oversight could also be expanded, while the Palestinian Autho...

item.title: Trade War Heats Up After Trump Orders Tariffs and Canada Retaliates
item.description: Amid warnings of price increases, Canada moved quickly to retaliate, China said it had planned countermeasures and Mexico said it would soon unveil it...

item.title: For China, Trump’s Moves Bring Pain, but Also Potential Gains
item.description: President Trump’s tariffs hurt China, but his other actions have alienated U.S. allies, giving Beijing an opening to strengthen its global standing.

item.title: 3 Mexican Sectors Most Affected by U.S. Tariffs, and How the Country Could Respond
item.description: President Trump’s tariffs will have major effects on Mexico’s auto industry, agriculture and energy, but the country has some means for responding.

item.title: What Blackstone looks for in a CEO for its companies
item.description: Blackstone follows a strict playbook to evaluate potential portfolio company CEO candidates, assessing their prospects for success and failure.

item.title: Elon Musk says he’s teaming up with Jamie Dimon to convince bond markets that cost-cutting DOGE is good for U.S. debt
item.description: Dimon and Musk's collaboration comes just weeks after Dimon offered to help the billionaire with his government cost-cutting initiative.

item.title: What CEOs really think of Trump’s tariffs
item.description: Also: Activist investor warns of crypto bubble, Dell shuts off remote work.

item.title: How the New Orleans Saints Helped the Catholic Church Handle a Sex-Abuse Scandal

item.title: Immigrant applicants left to navigate courts alone as DOJ tells nonprofit aid groups ‘to stop work immediately’
item.description: Donald Trump previously targeted these programs during his first term, but this time things are different.
